Summary Of PositionLionsgate is seeking a full-time Director to help drive paid media strategy and execute advertising campaigns in our Marketing department.As Media Director, you’ll lead day-to-day development of media planning and activation for films through their entire lifecycle (Theatrical/PVOD through Home Entertainment) with a strong focus on day and date, straight to VOD, and 3d party distributed titles. Media Planning and activation includes Digital/Social, National/Local Television (Broadcast, Cable, Hispanic, etc.), Radio and Outdoor media. Reports to SVP of Media and will manage a team of direct reports and coordinate with internal stakeholders, executives and agency partners.The ideal candidate will be a proven ‘self-starter’ who is comfortable managing a high volume of campaigns, tight deadlines and a fast-paced environment. A foundation in digital advertising with a focus on ROAS/transactional and traditional media is required and an interest in new and emerging media and ad tech/data platforms. Positivity, innate curiosity and a calm, steady outlook in the face of change are desired.ResponsibilitiesOversee the development of end-to-end media strategy and plans, working with SVP of Media and collaboratively with internal marketing disciplines to align media campaign strategies and efforts with larger marketing campaignWork with media agencies to ensure flawless planning and execution; push team to elevate work and thinkingTrack, analyze, and report data from campaigns weekly and uncover insights to refine and optimize both the media plan/strategy and inform creativeCollaborate with internal teams to create custom measurement and performance reports focusing on key metrics that drive the businessUphold all-encompassing media budgets in addition to various upfront and partner commitments Effectively manage your team, ad agencies, internal technology and analytics teams, and other media partners to help maximize ROI on marketing campaignsQualifications And SkillsBachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.S.) required6+ years of experience in media planning, buying, and executing across multiple platforms including TV, Digital, Paid Social, Paid Search, Radio, and Outdoor (preferably entertainment industry experience)Must have experience with transactional/home entertainment, day and date, straight to VOD media campaignsSeveral years of hands-on management experience requiredAbility to combine creative and analytical mindsets to build effective media campaignsBe able to translate data – performance, competitive, consumer and industry insights – into actionUp-to-date knowledge of publishers, content creators, media technologies, research companies and other vendors which we could partner withExperience in biddable media platforms and familiarity with DMPs, first-party data management, ad tech and analytical tools Strong written and presentation skills as well as ability to think strategically, creatively, analytically, and tactically in high demand, fast paced environmentAble to work independently and have excellent time management skillsProblem solver with the ability to develop creative solutionsOrganized, and detail-oriented with strong attention to follow-throughNimble and flexible to succeed in a fast-paced environment and handle ad hoc requestsStrong team player, with open-minded and inclusive attitudeResults driven with an excellent accuracy and attention to detailPassionate about traditional and digital media as well as movie marketingAbility to communicate effectively with media, marketing, ad tech, and senior executivesExcellence in performing and application of media math and analytical capabilitiesAbility to learn quickly and work well under pressure, prioritizing multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to thrive in a fast paced work environment and follow department protocolExcellence in MS Office required, specifically experience in creating detailed spreadsheets using Excel as well as developing PowerPoint presentationsAbout The CompanyLionsgate (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B) encompasses world-class motion picture and television studio operations aligned with the STARZ premium global subscription platform to bring a unique and varied portfolio of entertainment to consumers around the world. The Company’s film, television, subscription and location-based entertainment businesses are backed by a 17,000-title library and a valuable collection of iconic film and television franchises. A digital age company driven by its entrepreneurial culture and commitment to innovation, the Lionsgate brand is synonymous with bold, original, relatable entertainment for audiences worldwide.Business Unit OverviewMotion Picture GroupLionsgate’s motion picture business is a consistent box office market share leader with films that have grossed more than $10 billion worldwide over the past six years. This leadership is driven by world-class talent relationships, a deep and renewable portfolio of iconic brands and franchises, and a diverse and balanced slate that is built to enhance consumer enjoyment of the theatrical experience but also has the flexibility to utilize a broad range of alternative release strategies as the opportunities to monetize films continue to expand. The creator, owner and distributor of great film brands including The Hunger Games, Twilight Saga, John Wick, Now You See Me, Knives Out, La La Land, Saw, Dirty Dancing and Monster’s Ball, among many others, films released by Lionsgate and its predecessor companies have earned 129 Academy Award® nominations and 32 Oscar® wins.In addition to its mainstream commercial releases, Lionsgate’s Motion Picture Group includes specialty film distributor Roadside Attractions, an industry leader in award-winning prestige movies, Pantelion Films, the U.S. market leader in Spanish-language releases, a top film production and distribution brand in the UK, and multiplatform distributor Grindstone Entertainment.Our BenefitsFull Coverage – Medical, Vision, and DentalWork/Life Balance – generous sick days, vacation days, holidays, and Impact Day401(k) company matchingTuition Reimbursement (up to graduate degree)Compensation$100,000 - $120,000EEO StatementLionsgate is an equal employment opportunity employer. All employees and applicants are evaluated on the basis of their qualifications, consistent with applicable state and federal laws. In addition, Lionsgate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Lionsgate will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and federal law.
